description: Standard playbook for Software and SaaS procurement contracts

requirements.description: Clear license grant with defined scope and permitted uses
requirements.preferred_language: Vendor grants Customer a non-exclusive, non-transferable, worldwide license to use the Software for Customer's internal business purposes only. The license includes the right to install the Software on Customer-owned or controlled servers and allow authorized employees and contractors to access and use the Software.
key_points: Number of users or seats specified

requirements.description: Service Level Agreement with uptime guarantees and remedies
requirements.preferred_language: Vendor shall maintain the Software with 99.9% uptime, measured monthly. In the event of failure to meet the SLA, Customer shall receive service credits as follows: (i) 99.0-99.9% uptime: 10% monthly fee credit; (ii) 95.0-98.9% uptime: 25% monthly fee credit; (iii) below 95% uptime: 50% monthly fee credit and right to terminate.

requirements.description: GDPR and CCPA compliant data protection provisions
requirements.preferred_language: Vendor shall process all personal data in accordance with applicable data protection laws including GDPR and CCPA. Vendor shall: (i) implement appropriate technical and organizational measures; (ii) process data only on documented instructions from Customer; (iii) notify Customer of data breaches within 24 hours; (iv) assist with data subject rights requests; (v) delete or return data upon termination.

Vendor maintains SOC 2 Type II certification and implements industry-standard security controls including: (i) encryption of data at rest and in transit; (ii) regular security audits and penetration testing; (iii) access controls and authentication; (iv) security incident response procedures; (v) employee security training.

requirements.description: Customer retains ownership of all customer data and content
requirements.preferred_language: Customer retains all rights, title, and interest in and to Customer Data. Vendor acquires no rights in Customer Data except as necessary to provide the Services. Vendor grants Customer a license to any analytical data or reports generated from Customer Data.
key_points: Vendor has no IP rights in customer data
Rights to aggregated/anonymized data if any

requirements.description: Right to terminate for convenience with reasonable notice
requirements.preferred_language: Either party may terminate this Agreement for convenience upon ninety (90) days prior written notice to the other party. Upon termination, Customer shall receive a pro-rata refund of any prepaid fees for the unused portion of the term.

requirements.description: Reasonable liability cap with appropriate exceptions
requirements.preferred_language: Except for breaches of confidentiality, data protection obligations, IP infringement, gross negligence, or willful misconduct, each party's total liability under this Agreement shall be limited to the greater of: (i) twelve (12) months of fees paid or payable; or (ii) the total contract value.
key_points: Cap at 12 months fees or total contract value
Exceptions for: confidentiality, data breaches, IP, gross negligence, fraud

requirements.description: Right to export data at any time
requirements.preferred_language: Customer may export all Customer Data at any time during the term and for thirty (30) days following termination. Vendor shall provide data in standard, machine-readable formats (CSV, JSON, or XML) at no additional charge.

requirements.description: Auto-renewal without adequate notice period is prohibited
key_points: No auto-renewal without 90+ day notice requirement
If auto-renewal exists, must allow opt-out

requirements.description: Unlimited liability for Customer is not acceptable
key_points: Liability must be capped or mutual

requirements.description: Right to audit vendor's security and compliance
requirements.preferred_language: Customer may audit Vendor's compliance with this Agreement, including security controls and data processing practices, upon thirty (30) days prior written notice, during business hours, no more than once per year (or more frequently if required by law or following a security incident).

Vendor shall maintain: (i) commercial general liability insurance of at least $2,000,000; (ii) professional liability/errors & omissions insurance of at least $5,000,000; (iii) cyber liability insurance of at least $5,000,000; and (iv) workers' compensation as required by law. Vendor shall provide certificates of insurance upon request.
